comments.content:
Can you please let us know if you're using an admin credential for trying to create the instance?

Looks quite similar to https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1657774 but you're getting HTTP500 instead and I could suspect a misconfiguration if that's happening reproducibly every boot request.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sylvain-bauza

comments.content:
Hi, 

Yes 'm using admin credentials to create instance. 

Nova.conf

grep ^[^#] /etc/nova/nova.conf
[DEFAULT]
dhcpbridge_flagfile=/etc/nova/nova.conf
dhcpbridge=/usr/bin/nova-dhcpbridge
force_dhcp_release=true
state_path=/var/lib/nova
enabled_apis=osapi_compute,metadata
log_dir=/var/log/nova
notification_driver = messagingv2
instance_usage_audit = True
instance_usage_audit_period = hour
notify_on_state_change = vm_and_task_state
host = controller
use_neutron = True
firewall_driver = nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver
my_ip = 10.0.0.201
osapi_compute_workers = 4
start_guests_on_host_boot = False
resume_guests_state_on_host_boot = False
transport_url = rabbit://openstack:password@10.0.0.201:5672//openstack
[api]
auth_strategy = keystone
neutron_default_tenant_id=default

comments.content: Automatically discovered version ocata in description. If this is incorrect, please update the description to include 'nova version: ...'
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content:
I'm seeing a similar issue with my Ocata setup. The error occurs only if I enable
the 'service_token_roles_required = true' option in the neutron configuration file. Maybe you could disable this option, restart neutron-server and see if that makes things better ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~stefan.nica

comments.content:
If service_token_roles_required is enabled, then the service_token_roles configuration option should also be set appropriately. The default value 'service' might correspond to the service user role used on your system.

I corrected my configuration (was using 'admin' instead of 'service') and things are fine now.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~stefan.nica
